class service.forms.ColorInput(attrs=None)[source]¶

Bases: Input

A custom form widget that renders an input field of type ‘color’.

This widget allows the user to select a color from a color picker. It is used for fields where the user needs to choose a color, such as service-specific color preferences.

Parameters:

input_type – The input type is set to ‘color’, enabling the color picker in HTML forms.

input_type = 'color'¶
property media¶
class service.forms.ServiceForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: ModelForm

A form for managing ‘Service’ objects, including fields for name, category, price, duration, and availability. Custom widgets are used for enhanced user experience, and a custom clean_duration method validates the ‘duration’ field.

Parameters:

Meta – Specifies the model and fields to be used in the form. It also configures widgets to customize the appearance of the form fields, such as adding placeholder text and applying specific CSS classes.

Returns:

A ModelForm based on the Service model that handles service data input.

class Meta[source]¶

Bases: object

Defines the model, fields to include, and widgets for form rendering.

clean_duration()[source]¶

Clean and validate the duration field.

Converts the duration input to a timedelta object.

Raises:

ValidationError – If the duration format is invalid.

Returns:

A timedelta object representing the service duration.

This model stores information about service categories, including the name and color.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
services¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class service.models.Service(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Model

Represents a service offered.

This model stores information about services, including name, duration, price, category, and availability.

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

appointments¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

available¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

category¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

class service.models.Voucher(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Model

Represents a voucher for services.

This model stores information about vouchers, including name, associated services, number of sessions, pricing, and discount information.

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

clean()[source]¶

Validates the voucher data.

Raises:

ValidationError – If the discount is not between 0 and 100, or if the price is not greater than 0.

Views¶

service.views.add_category(request)[source]¶

Add a new category.

This view handles both GET and POST requests for adding a new category. It renders a form for category creation and processes the form submission.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered HTML page with the category creation form or redirect to category list.

service.views.add_service(request)[source]¶

Add a new service.

This view handles both GET and POST requests for adding a new service. It renders a form for service creation and processes the form submission.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered HTML page with the service creation form or redirect to category list.

service.views.add_voucher(request)[source]¶

Add a new voucher.

This view handles both GET and POST requests for adding a new voucher. It renders a form for voucher creation and processes the form submission.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered HTML page with the voucher creation form or redirect to voucher list.

service.views.delete_category(request, category_id)[source]¶

Delete a specific category.

This view handles the deletion of a category. It requires a POST request to actually delete the category.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • category_id – The ID of the category to be deleted.

Returns:

Redirect to the category list page after successful deletion, or confirmation page for GET requests.

Raises:

Http404 – If the category with the given ID does not exist.

service.views.delete_service(request, service_id)[source]¶

Delete a specific service.

This view handles the deletion of a service. It requires a POST request to actually delete the service.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • service_id – The ID of the service to be deleted.

Returns:

Redirect to the category list page after successful deletion, or confirmation page for GET requests.

Raises:

Http404 – If the service with the given ID does not exist.

service.views.delete_voucher(request, voucher_id)[source]¶

Delete a specific voucher.

This view handles the deletion of a voucher. It requires a POST request to actually delete the voucher.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • voucher_id – The ID of the voucher to be deleted.

Returns:

Redirect to the voucher list page after successful deletion, or confirmation page for GET requests.

Raises:

Http404 – If the voucher with the given ID does not exist.

service.views.details_voucher(request, voucher_id)[source]¶

Display details of a specific voucher.

This view retrieves and displays the details of a single voucher.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • voucher_id – The ID of the voucher to be viewed.

Returns:

Rendered HTML page with the voucher details.

Raises:

Http404 – If the voucher with the given ID does not exist.

service.views.edit_category(request, category_id)[source]¶

Edit an existing category.

This view handles both GET and POST requests for editing a category. It retrieves the category details, renders a form for editing, and processes the form submission.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • category_id – The ID of the category to be edited.

Returns:

Rendered HTML page with the category edit form or redirect to category list.

Raises:

Http404 – If the category with the given ID does not exist.

service.views.edit_service(request, service_id)[source]¶

Edit an existing service.

This view handles both GET and POST requests for editing a service. It retrieves the service details, renders a form for editing, and processes the form submission.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • service_id – The ID of the service to be edited.

Returns:

Rendered HTML page with the service edit form or redirect to service view.

Raises:

Http404 – If the service with the given ID does not exist.

service.views.edit_voucher(request, voucher_id)[source]¶

Edit an existing voucher.

This view handles both GET and POST requests for editing a voucher. It retrieves the voucher details, renders a form for editing, and processes the form submission.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • voucher_id – The ID of the voucher to be edited.

Returns:

Rendered HTML page with the voucher edit form or redirect to voucher details.

Raises:

Http404 – If the voucher with the given ID does not exist.

service.views.list_category(request)[source]¶

Display a list of all categories and services without a category.

This view retrieves all categories and services that do not belong to any category.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered HTML page with the list of categories and services without a category.

service.views.search_items(request, model_name)[source]¶

Search for services or vouchers based on a query.

This view handles searching for services or vouchers based on the provided query and model name.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • model_name – The name of the model to search (‘service’ or ‘voucher’).

Returns:

Rendered HTML page with the search results.

service.views.services_category(request, category_id)[source]¶

Display services for a specific category.

This view retrieves all services for a given category and paginates the results.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • category_id – The ID of the category whose services are being viewed.

Returns:

Rendered HTML page with the list of services for the category.

Raises:

Http404 – If the category with the given ID does not exist.

service.views.services_without_category(request)[source]¶

Display services that do not belong to any category.

This view retrieves all services that have no associated category.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered HTML page with the list of services without a category.

Display details of a specific service.

This view retrieves and displays the details of a single service.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • service_id – The ID of the service to be viewed.

Returns:

Rendered HTML page with the service details.

Raises:

Http404 – If the service with the given ID does not exist.

service.views.voucher_list(request)[source]¶

Display a list of all vouchers.

This view retrieves all vouchers and paginates the results.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered HTML page with the list of vouchers.

URLs¶

URL routing configuration for the service management application.

This module defines the URL patterns for the Service Management application. It maps URLs to view functions, allowing users to interact with services, categories, and vouchers.

URL Patterns:

Service Views: - ‘service/add/’: Maps to the add_service view for creating a new service. - ‘service/edit/<int:service_id>/’: Maps to the edit_service view for editing an existing service. - ‘service/delete/<int:service_id>/’: Maps to the delete_service view for deleting a service. - ‘service/services/category/<int:category_id>/’: Maps to the services_category view for listing services in a category. - ‘service/services/no-category/’: Maps to the services_without_category view for listing services without a category. - ‘service/view/<int:service_id>/’: Maps to the view_details_service view for viewing service details.

Category Views: - ‘category/list/’: Maps to the list_category view for listing all categories. - ‘category/add/’: Maps to the add_category view for creating a new category. - ‘category/edit/<int:category_id>/’: Maps to the edit_category view for editing an existing category. - ‘category/delete/<int:category_id>/’: Maps to the delete_category view for deleting a category.

Voucher Views: - ‘voucher/add/’: Maps to the add_voucher view for creating a new voucher. - ‘voucher/delete/<int:voucher_id>’: Maps to the delete_voucher view for deleting a voucher. - ‘voucher/details/<int:voucher_id>’: Maps to the details_voucher view for viewing voucher details. - ‘voucher/edit/<int:voucher_id>’: Maps to the edit_voucher view for editing an existing voucher. - ‘voucher/list/’: Maps to the voucher_list view for listing all vouchers.

Shared Views: - ‘shared/items/search/<str:model_name>’: Maps to the search_items view for searching items across different models.

Note

The ‘app_name’ variable is set to ‘service’, which is used for namespacing these URLs.

Usage:

To include these URLs in the main project URLs, use: path(‘services/’, include(‘service.urls’))
